description: From Middle English dredli, dredlich, dredlyche, dredeliche, equivalent to dread +‎ -ly.

adjectives.description: dreadly (comparative more dreadly, superlative most dreadly)

examples: At thy approach, black shades did vanish, / And from my heart thou feare didst banish, / And in their room did light appear, / And joy instead of dreadly feare.

description: From Middle English dredly, dredliche, equivalent to dread +‎ -ly.

adverbs.description: dreadly (comparative more dreadly, superlative most dreadly)

examples: So shall you see a Cloud-crown'd Hill somtime, / Torn from a greater by the waste of Time; / Dreadly to shake, and boundling down to hop, / And roaring, here it roules tall Cedars up;
